statement:
Let $U$ be an open set in $R^m$, $V$ be an open set in $R^n$ and
$f: U \to V$ be a $C^k$ function. If $k \geq m/n$, then the set of
critical values of $f$ has $n$-dimensional measure zero.

[99]{} S.G. Krantz, H. R. Parks, *The Implicit Function Theorem:
History, Theory, and Applications*, Birkhäuser, Boston, c. 2002 H.
Federer, *Geometric Measure Theory*, Springer-Verlag, New York, 1969
